Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Maternal , fetal , and neonatal complications are examined .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Maternal |
| Fetal |
| Neonatal |

In this paragraph, the terms "Maternal," "Fetal," and "Neonatal" can be considered as diseases or health-related conditions. "Maternal" refers to any medical condition related to pregnancy and childbirth affecting the mother. "Fetal" refers to medical conditions or complications that affect the fetus during pregnancy. "Neonatal" refers to medical conditions or complications that affect newborn babies during the first 28 days of life.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Maternal complications |
| Fetal complications |
| Neonatal complications |

In this revised paragraph, the terms "Maternal complications," "Fetal complications," and "Neonatal complications" can be considered as diseases or health-related conditions. These terms refer to any medical conditions or complications that affect the mother during pregnancy, the fetus during pregnancy, and newborn babies during the first 28 days of life, respectively.
